Public markets are becoming more volatile due to geopolitical tensions, trade disputes and rising interest rates.

articles.title: New wealth fund could buy TikTok, says Trump
articles.author: The Standard
articles.summary: Donald Trump signed an executive order on Monday ordering the creation of a sovereign wealth fund within the next year. The fund could be used to invest in infrastructure projects, manufacturing and medical research. It could also buy short video app TikTok, which has about 170 million American users. The fate of the app has been up in the air since a law requiring its Chinese owner ByteDance to sell it or face a ban took effect on January 19.

articles.title: FTX Bahamas ‘shoots for' February 18 first payout
articles.author: NEIL HARTNELL
articles.summary: FTX's Bahamian liquidators are'shooting for' February 18 as the date to start payouts to small creditors and victims owed less than $50,000 as a result of the crypto exchange's fraud-driven implosion. People in the 'convenience' class account for around 80 percent of all FTX Digital Markets creditors. The timing of their payout will depend on whether they have fulfilled Know Your Customer (KYC) and other conditions.
